Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I tried to write a post before but it didn't seem to work. 6 months ago I found a horizontal lump, (5 cms long now) below my collarbone and just above my left breast. I believe it has grown in size and it has just started to become visible. It is hard and unmoveable and is not painful. I was wondering if anyone has had a similar lump before? And perhaps might now what it might be? It almost feels like a protruding rib. I have finally mustered up the courage to go and see the doctor. Any advice/comments would be deeply appreciated
Posts.Title: Lump Below Collar bone, above breast - need advice

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your reply. Even if I'll feel silly going to the doctor, I suppose you're right, it's better to be safe then sorry
Posts.Title: Lump Below Collar bone, above breast - need advice

Posts.Content: I've had to cancel my appointment as I'm too busy on that day. I might go see the doctor in the next week or so as I don't think this lump is too serious to go see a doctor straight away. I think it might just be that my rib has protruded. My left leg has been really hurting lately so I might go see someone about that.
Posts.Title: Lump Below Collar bone, above breast - need advice

Posts.Content: Ok, finally went to the doctor today I didn't get a chance to tell him about the lump on my chest though :/ I had a few other more pressing issues. My left leg has been really hurting/aching for the last year, especially after I exercise or have a big day on my feet. As soon as I told him my symptoms he send me to get an x-ray. I'll be going back for an appointment about the x-rays as soon as I call and book one. Here's crossing my fingers it's nothing!
Posts.Title: Lump Below Collar bone, above breast - need advice

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry to hear this about your mother. I can't really give you any advice, but I will be praying for you and your family and sending hugs your way. Milly
Posts.Title: Her2 Breast cancer, oral chemo, morphine nausea advice?

Posts.Content: I've had breast pain and pain under my right arm many times. The pain under my right arm was like a shooting pain and it would radiate up to my lower right breast. When I went to see my doctor (I had a lump under my arm at the same time, which turned out to be nothing) she told me it was nothing to be worried about and completely normal. But of course, everyone is different and if you're worried about it definitely go check it out!
Posts.Title: A lot of pain...help, please
